description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

The Google Store (e-Commerce) is Google’s fast-growing owned and operated online store that showcases and sells new devices made with Google technology. On a day-to-day basis, the Google Store marketing team is brainstorming innovative ideas to showcase flagship products.

You will define Google Store’s forecasting methods to improve our capacity to be more forward looking and predictive globally. You will help us develop a deeper understanding of traffic and trends for our and provide a comprehensive view of our overall business performance, and apply those insights to deliver strategic recommendations to help grow the ecommerce business.

You are passionate about using advanced statistical methods, data visualization, and tools to accurately forecast traffic. Further, you will be responsible for coordinating how insights and data are used and consumed and will be closely collaborating with cross-functional teams across Google Store.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Finance, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience analyzing data through advanced statistical, quantitative modeling and forecasting methods.
  • 4 years of Marketing experience
  • Experience with SQL.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with BI, data visualization (Tableau, Data Studio or similar) and statistical software (R, S-Plus, SAS, or similar).
  • Experience in e-commerce and driving demand on global digital properties (e.g., SEO, SEM, etc.)
  • Experience with Google Analytics or similar web analytics tools.
  • Ability to draw conclusions from data and recommend actions.
  • Ability to communicate and influence effectively by presenting data in a compelling way.
  • Strong bias for action. Ability to manage multiple priorities and create a sense of urgency in a fast-paced, dynamic (and many times, ambiguous) environment.
responsibilities:
• Lead and partner with cross-functional teams to develop short-term global forecasts based on data-driven models drawing from multiple of analytical methods to choose the right tool and level of complexity needed to address business challenges.
  • Define key metrics required to evaluate performance and make recommendations to leadership based on performance against goals.
  • Develop, improve and maintain forecasting and predictive analytics tools.
  • Translate analysis results into business recommendations. Compile analyses for reports and make effective and persuasive presentations (verbal and written) to a broad audience to shape strategic and operational decisions.
  • Engage broadly with the organization to identify, prioritize, frame, and structure complex and ambiguous challenges, where advanced analytics projects or tools can have the biggest impact.
title: Lead Forecasting Analyst, Google Store
